reviewText:
The combat is smooth. I've tried 3/4 classes and they all play uniquely and the feel of the leveling system is awesome.

The core of the game is great.  So far I haven't found any need to pay for anything...and haven't seen any pay to win. I subscribed for a month of Patron because I feel that I should support the developer.

There are things that I don't like about this game:

1) Forced PvP - The whole unique part to the game is your Devilian form. The only way to gear that part of your character is to play in PvP.
2) Limited Content - 2 Weeks After release and many players are already left with grinding out the last few stats.

I would recommend this for casual players, and I will continue to check back in on the game over time to see what improvements and content is added to the game.  The core is very solid, and it has some growing pains to go through since its so young.  Be patient with it or wait a little while before you try.

reviewText:
Pretty good game if you're into MMO's but prefer ARPG's. It's gender-locked, but who cares? Overall fun game for a little bit, but I can't recommend it due to the horrible pvp balance. Skill can play a role, but basically the team with the most evokers almost always wins. One evoker can take out 5 players easy. Their combination of damage and CC is too strong, making the pvp boring and to make it worse, the developers haven't acknowledged it and probably will never fix it.

Items are closer to marvel heroes than they are d3/PoE, and when I think of an ARPG my focus is the items & the builds. Builds are limited to 3 specs for each class, so very little variety. As far as an ARPG goes, this game is ♥♥♥♥. But the gameplay aside from that is decent.

tldr; took an MMORPG and gave it isometric graphics to call it an MMO-ARPG.

reviewText:
The combat is smooth. I've tried 3/4 classes and they all play uniquely and the feel of the leveling system is awesome.

The core of the game is great.  So far I haven't found any need to pay for anything...and haven't seen any pay to win. I subscribed for a month of Patron because I feel that I should support the developer.

There are things that I don't like about this game:

1) Forced PvP - The whole unique part to the game is your Devilian form. The only way to gear that part of your character is to play in PvP.
2) Limited Content - 2 Weeks After release and many players are already left with grinding out the last few stats.

I would recommend this for casual players, and I will continue to check back in on the game over time to see what improvements and content is added to the game.  The core is very solid, and it has some growing pains to go through since its so young.  Be patient with it or wait a little while before you try.

reviewText:
I love this game, a lot. I was excited for it's release and played it on the day it was open to all players.
Playing this game for so many long hours and then realizing a lot of it. In my personal opinion, this game is really a pay-to-play game. When I say the tempest release I was excited, but saw that you had to pay for it, but of course, it's a different gameplay than  other classes. It somewhat makes sense, but not really at the same time.
*Pros:
-You kill things, kite, and pretty much just use one skill to kill everything.
-Similar to Diablo gameplay, Diablo lovers may like this game.
-Loads of quests and group dungeons.
-Hillarious to play with friends.
-PVP is entertaining to watch between players.
-The Devillian form is an intresting mechanic and is quite fun.
*Cons:
-Other than the quest line, you have to pay for it.
-You can't play the amazing tempest class without paying.
-Gets kinda boring after you get the skill that kills everything.
-You don't really take damage, unless you play cannnoner, then you take some.
-Boss questing with friends is glitchy, you sometimes don't finish the quest if you or your friend kills it.
-Literally the story is really boring and just the cliche, oh no there is demons killing everyone help story.
Would I recommend this game?
No. Just no. I would only suggest it to someone who would be willing to pay for most of the gameplay. Only if it was like Diablo, just multiplayer... Of course it has hours worth of gameplay and hillarity behind it's gameplay, but really I suggest you don't play it.

reviewText:
I rarely review on here but I thought I should since it's a mixed opinion at the time of writing.

To the point, this is the best MMO'A'RPG I've ever played. It is NOT the best ARPG out there but it's the best massively multiplayer one.

The easiest way for me to describe this game is if Diablo and Aion had a baby. The combat feels decent, there's lots to do, advancement/progression is very quick to start with and it seems polished so far.

If you like ARPGs then you should definately try it since it's free.

reviewText: This game, altho visually pleasing is created only and specifically for few focus groups. You have your usual brutal or agile characters namely Berserker and Shadowhunter, the sweet girl mage, then the hentai asian girl for the perverted pedophiles thats called the Cannoneer. From the very beginning the game is carrying you by your virgin hand through almost everything. There is autorun to questgivers.. So you press autorun, then you press F five times get another quest and you press autorun to run to the location where you press 123, kill everything in one hit and then autorun back to the quest giver. Do you even need me for the gameplay? Another atrocity are the announcements which i found no way to turn off. Screen is littered with information from the getgo, the combat makes it even worse with stylized critical hits and colorful numbers. This game speaks clearly about its intentions from the beginning -\n\nWe are here to take your money

reviewText:
Hi I'm F2P, cool, let's try you out.

Decent graphics, gender locked-red flag #1, but I like playing a female so no biggie to me. Got 1 toon to lvl52 (max) and one to lvl 40. Combat is fun and fast, and I would expect this from the same people who made Tera. You get 24 spaces in your inventory and trust me you're going to need a lot more, which will cost you real money. And even if you get Patron (which is a sub) you still have to play 5 days to get 15 log in points just to buy 8 inventory spaces, red flag #2.

Making gold was very slow at the beginning but I heard it was much easier in higher levels. Kinda true but everything costs more, you need to upgrade everything to progress in end game and that all costs in game gold. With Patron you can buy and sell on the auction house, except there's no money to be made or never enough, which forces you to buy dex from Trion to sell in game for gold - red flag #3.

The drop rate for butchery gear (2nd highest in game) is really low unless you make pre-made parties of 3 and enter, don't look for parties you will never get a piece. You will also need gems, runes etc.. so it's grinding the SAME dungeons over and over.

Hop on the gear treadmill 'cause it going to be a long ride, strictly for them to make more money. Don't get me wrong, I know game makers want to make money, but this isn't the way--it's like gambling 'cause the RNG is high in this game. I spent 60 bucks and played 97 hours. id I get my moneys worth? Kinda. Wish I would have not spent so much time on something that's going nowhere. Save your time and money. You have been warned, but it is your time and money. Proceed with caution is all I am saying..

reviewText: All the people who don't recommend this are saying that it is pay2win, the game isn't pay to win it just has a semi grindy feeling. As far as leveling up goes the quest line could use work however the dungeons are what we play for and they are spectacular. End game is fairly easy, and its fairly easy to gear your charachter in butchery gear but past that you get the more grindy feeling. This game isn't bad it just requires you to do a bit of work and mat grinding to get better. The social aspect at end game is absolutely huge you need to make friends or you wont be doing much harder content without a gold fee. The gold in this game is harder to come by then in most games so when you first start out avoid the AH completely you don't need it and will regret it when you reach the level cap. However overall this game is great yes it does make it easier if you spend real money for your mats but you don't have to and that little pay for an advantage is in almost any free to play game, how else would they be making profit off this?

reviewText:
A really cool game! It's a mix between World of warcraft and diablo. You have the combat system and the way to kill monsters from Diablo, and the open world from WoW. It's a very good combination! Here is some Pros / Cons about the game, I will also explain why I made these Pros / Cons, thanks! Enjoy

Pros:
+ Free to play, easy to get your friends into the game since they don't have to pay.
+ Easy to level up at lower levels, in other words... very easy to get a quick feeling about the game.
+ They update the game and really care about it.
+ Everything that is in the store for real money is also buyable with ingame gold, which makes the game not pay to win.
+ A good community, people care about their own stuffs instead of putting the blame on others, and most of them are willing to help with any questions you may have ingame.
+ It's very simple to understand the point of the game and learning new things, pretty self-explanatory.

Cons:
- It was some server problems on release date that made many people blame the game and so on.
- If you want to get access to things quicker you can buy things ingame with real money.

Aight, the Pros are kinda easy to see what I mean, so I will focuse on the Cons here, and the thing is that.. when Devilian released, the game had problems with the main server of EU called Seadrift, that problem was pretty huge, it was offline for every night for 3 days, about 4 hours every night and also they end that with a 24 hours maintence.
That made alot of people blame and flame and cry about the game and spamming bad reviews around, and I admit that it was pretty annoying, but it worked perfectly after that maintence and they mostly did it to make sure it won't happend again.
They also gave every player 3-days of 50% xp boost and such, so now the server are very stable and It's really worth going into this game.

So, many people blame and flame and so on that this game is pay to win, I guess 95% of those people who say it's pay to win, don't know what they talking about at all. To make this clear:

P2W = Pay to Win = If you can buy things in the game that is only accessable with real money which makes people who spend real money on the game extremly overpowered compared to others, and there is no way for regular players to have a fair chance to win against the guy who used real money. That is Pay to win, nothing els. For example, 99% of every game out there have people in their hometown of the game that spam things about goldsellers, and since you can buy gold from those people and get  better " than others... that makes the game pay to win?

This game dosen't have Pay to win

reviewText:
TLDR:  I've put a lot of time and effort into this game (300+ hours); Also a good bit of cash, which I am now regretting.  I'm getting fed up with games that promise to deliver content and expand upon it in a timely manner only to have the companies renege and disappoint entire communities. When dealing with the support for this game, it feels like an after thought;  Like they aren't taking it seriously and have no communication with one another.  The web page itself feels like a slapped together wordpress blog with a free forum board strapped to it with ductape;  It's insulting. ((I'm a web desinger/developer.  I notice that stuff.)) There isn't enough content to keep most hard core players interested.  Wide spread bans, lagging, exploits and bot issues are another huge turn off.  What the game promised through game play in the begining, it failed miserably to deliver at the end.


-------------------------------------
I can't justify continuing to play.  I'm not even as geared as I could be but I honestly can't bring myself to follow through grinding out runes from AD and dust for talismans as there is no content to aim for coming out in the immediate future.  So what am I supposed to do?  Spend the next month grinding the same dungeons over and over again for gear and stats I'll replace when the new content arrives?  Am I supposed to enjoy the ever shrinking population of pvpers?  I feel like the new daily gifts are a 'please stick around' consolation prize for all the banning, lagging, exploits and bots.

The lag issues that effected the entire NA Asperon server where horrendous.  When support was contacted, despite this being a SERVER WIDE ISSUE, the players were blamed.  *sarcasm*  Of course!  Thousands of players all having lag issues --all at the same time-- must be a software issue; something in our startup.  Obvious.

And then there was the exploit that they released with the game that they KNEW was there since alpha essentially allowing players the opportunity to screw up the leveling curve, the economy and the community when the exploiters where finally banned... after two weeks.  I know two weeks doesn't sound like an awful lot to some, but to others that first two weeks in the game is when you set your pace.  The first two weeks is when you find your companions/friends.  Those first two weeks after release, pretty damn important to someone who wants to push content.

I love the community in this game; Amazing people - I've made some great friends that I really hope to cary on gaming with.  And the game play itself is amazing -- There's just not enough of it to keep hard core MMO players occupied.  Overwhelming at the beginning, but you can knock it all out with effort and time.  Maybe I chew up content too quickly, but I don't feel like there is enough.  When the new stuff comes out, will I devour it just as quickly and be bored again?  I feel like that will definitely be the case.

reviewText:
despite all the negative reviews, i actually like it. Yeah they released new class that costs money, but then again there are $60 games that sell classes too so i can see how one game thats very f2p friendly could ask for your money.

entire game is f2p, patron (monthly sub) benefits are minor too so i really dont understand all the *p2w* fuss, and im totally against p2w games. Im not saying its not possible to progress faster if you spend real money, because that wouldnt be true, but the game really is perfectly playable as a free player too. And if you think this cash shop is bad, then you havent played Allods or Archeage :)

I did start a bit late though, so i missed first few months so not really sure how was it back then but even now, after all supposed nerfs i find it very playable as a f2p player.
Not to mention you could actually buy cash shop currency with in game money, which would let you buy new class with in game gold, so for ones that can stomach a grind, thats an option too. Afterall, its arpg so grinding instances is name of the genre :P

reviewText:
It's surprisingly good. I always wondered why there hasn't been a game like this? combining the combat/skill system of diablo 3 and put it into a MMORPG setting. And the customization and talisman card etc are so in depth there is a lot you can explore in this game. To be honest, the talisman cards can literally be its own game, like a mobile game or something. It's that much you can explore. And it'll never bore you.

However, unlike many MMOs, this game is very casual to play. All the quests are quick. And there's even an auto-run button that auto runs your toon to the target location to do/pick-up/turn-in quests. You can finish a dungeon in less than 10min. And because it's the diablo 3 combat, it's also a lot more casual. You can just log in and play for 15 min as a break to whatever you're doing and then go back and do what you want to do. It's not like some MMOs you'll have to be on for 1-2 hours for a raid.

And... this game has guilds, raid, ops etc. I think this will cater to many many players who want a game you can explore deep, but one that also let you play it very casually.

So far, there are only 4 classes. I hope they can add more classes/characters. This game has so much potential, they can even add champions like those MOBA games for players to play.

If you gather up 5 groups of mobs in this game and kill them all, your EXP bar actually goes up! 52 levels in 8 days is a nice pace...for me anyway. Obviously I tossed them twenty bucks and got an exp item which helped...a lot.. hehe. Devilian deserves it. I hope to see more classes and improved drop rates? There seems to be this bug going around where dungeons aren't dropping proper loot, just a few measly silver coins. Not sure if intentional.\n\nOn a scale of NO!-to-best MMO I haven't seen yet? Devilian gets a solid OKAY to play!

reviewText:
Preface
I have spent some odd 30 hours playing Devilian having previous experiences with both paid for and free to play games from similar genre, including Diablo 2 & 3, Grim Dawn, various Adventures of Van Helsing games, Titan Quest and Path of Exile.

I will not be reviewing game components such as graphics or gameplay features, the first can be checked by anyone from videos in the store or on Youtube, the later I'm not able to fully judge since I have not reached end-game nor I discovered all the features in my time with the game.

Technical issues
What need to be mentioned are server stability issues that I have encountered during my play time. European server Seadrift had huge problems with stability and data loss. All characters lost their progress and gear day or 2 after my start. The server later went offline for nearly 2 days due to maintenance and there was another disruption of service for all users due to crashed login verification server. Why is this important? Most paid features seems to be time limited, which might be problematic if you pay for patron access or somethign similar and you cant play.

Bad, Ugly...Microtransactions
I want to comment on the payment/microtransaction model and the way game is designed around it. I will say it upfront that I have not explored all of options nor experienced complete game, I decided to stop playing before I could do so.

Unfortunately, this game resembles mobile free-to-play games in its design that is made to purposefuly annoy players and force them to buy microtransactions. This is something I'm not willing to tolerate on PC titles. I want to enjoy games, not being annoyed by them knowing such annoyance is done on purpose.
The game has paid transportation system with ingame currency but you soon realize it is very pricey for amount of ingame currency you earn, at least at start. Your free teleport to city/village is on 30 minutes cooldown on free account, 10 seconds on patron paid account. Your inventory is extremely limited to the point you either ignore loot, salvage it (which costs huge amount of ingame currency if you are a starter and you get lot of loot as you progress) or spend unholy amount of time traveling to nearest merchant and back to your grinding location. You have storage space in cities/villages, which can be accessed remotely--you get free trial for 7 days, after which you must pay for it. Given how small your inventory is, it is nearly mandatory to buy remote warehouse access (patron account). I almost forgot to mention you cant send email from free account, supposedly to prevent spamming and scamming as explained by the deveoper...

Conclusion, TLDR
I have spent 1000s of hours playing Path of Exile, which has one of best and most fair microtransaction models, therefore, I know  free to play games can be enjoyable. I have spent 100s of hours in paid for ARPG titles, which were mostly worth their price with few misses here and there. Devilian did not convince me to spend my hard earned cash on the game. In fact and to my surprise, the game did not even try to entice me and drag me into its world. Restriction are ever present from very start, the game design focused on pushing you to spend money on microtransaction. Quests are bland and uninspiring to a point where you dont read the flavor text and just auto-run (game feature) to location where you kill stuff.

I can not recommend this game for people that are looking for next ARPG title either seeking novelty, refreshment or just to kill some time. There are better alternatives on the market in both paid for and free to play categories.

reviewText:
Do you like the feel and time input of MMOs like I do but hate the slow pacing?  The speed of this game is what keeps me coming back, from pulling whole quest areas and then proceeding to take all my focus to not get wombo'd by the massive group I just pulled, to the super speedy dungeon runs there is very little downtime when playing.  The classes are decently varied with various builds to do (you can combine specs for specific skills you would like, such as grabbing a taunt from one beserker spec to use on a different spec for better threat).  Leveling is a very welcomed and decent speed as I've hit lvl 50 in about 24 hours play time.

Most of the gripes people have about the game come from limited inventory space, which I agree with.  There are however free albeit time consuming ways to get your inventory expanded for free (it requires you to buy currency with ingame gold and then spending login points on inventory space).  If you enjoy the game, buying the 20 dollar starter pack gives you all the inventory you'll need.

Pros:
-Fast paced
-Fun classes
-Easy to attain max level
-Easy to grasp gearing at max level
-Fun guild system

Cons:
-Limited number of classes (more to come apparently)
-Low inventory space early on
-Sometimes spammy combat (could be a pro for some)
-Talisman system could use some work :\ (feels a bit luck-based rather than just putting in hard work)

reviewText:
1st impressions... so I got to the castle, felt like it was a background ripped from the final act in Diablo III (the heaven part), with a character I made in Continent of the Ninth Seal super jigglin boobies every step you take, probably one of this game's brightest features right there, and I had spells (enchantress i think or caster class- female was only option for that class i think, very little in the way of custom look- small handful anyway,  and with spells kinda like something from Path of Exile only a little beefed up from that.. spells feel awesome and shoot really fast until you run out of sp... feels awesome there- like old school nintendo game fun in a good way but lacking a certain element or three to make it perfectly gel together as far as movement goes.  this would be uber awesome if you guys made it into a 2 Dimensional side-scrolling game and let me use a joystick, then there'd be  no need to go all crazy with (god forbid) something like MOUSE LOOK MODE (!!!) ha ha or even a way to turn the dang camera angle by like clicking and dragging with the mouse, nope

now hear me out...  the old school isometric top down games of the past that ruled like Final Fantasy Tactics and Fallout Tactics you didn't really need to turn the camera because mainly it was turn based and you weren't shoved out there with this body expected to run sideways and dash to the left and right  and up and down and blast enemies that come from all four directions at once, often i found my lightning bolt firing off the wrong way (is there a way to target your enemy? could you make at least an auto lock (which could be toggled with a hotkey) on nearby targets you're facing or something for when i'm shooting towards the camera while facing it?? please.)   the artwork i like, holy wow transform into winged super nekkid devil lady with jigglin' boobies ohh yeahhh, sweet, and spells get different in devil mode kool yes

fun fast button masher not really an RPG at all except there's maybe some backstory or something and you fight lesser mobs which constantly respawn in regular zones leading up to a boss in a cave and loot equip, pick a couple new spells when you level up not really a whole lot of options there so far, get the next one the next ok.  lol whipped through to about level 19 in what felt like a couple hours kinda semi addictive possibililties, seemed like less of a chance for Trion to totally screw over frree to play like they did with Archeage by creating such a messed up labor system that will not give me enough labor (as a free to play) to complete the level 50+ quests to make an obsidian weapon.  Devilian... think side scroller hack and slash fun times especially if you play with other players maybe but Devilian, you should have taken more notes from Symphony of the Night. ya no need for camera mode revamp if you just make a patch that creates a nice autolock-on feature to help actually hit the enemies because I am having a difficult time aiming my spells at the enemies and like say my lightning bolt has ten seconds on cooldown or something it keeps shooting the wrong way helllppp ppllleeaaassee ;p

Final first look analysis: ok it looks kool pretty much like the art makes me feel like I'm doing Dark Blood Online which is nice since Dark Blood went Offline (sad face, also Dark Blood allowed joystick controll btw)  yeah can't knock this ♥♥♥♥ if they're giving it away right? well guess again! i friggin hate the dang christmas music in the castle, turn that $%% the hell off! I'm gonna go play some of these other games i can kick back and use the controller on until the xmas is over and you update that, plenty other awesome games, I recommend checking out Snail's new Black Gold Online also for free to play, the guys who made Age of Wushu did something crazy with flying dragon mounts and robots and there is a mouse look / camera turn function to look at the slightly buggy beautiful artworks in high detail with a new custom designed and self built mid atx tower I have decided to call her The Stealth Ninja Assassin 5000 it's a beast and quiet as hell xD coming for you in the dead of night so sleep tight

reviewText:
Preface
I have spent some odd 30 hours playing Devilian having previous experiences with both paid for and free to play games from similar genre, including Diablo 2 & 3, Grim Dawn, various Adventures of Van Helsing games, Titan Quest and Path of Exile.

I will not be reviewing game components such as graphics or gameplay features, the first can be checked by anyone from videos in the store or on Youtube, the later I'm not able to fully judge since I have not reached end-game nor I discovered all the features in my time with the game.

Technical issues
What need to be mentioned are server stability issues that I have encountered during my play time. European server Seadrift had huge problems with stability and data loss. All characters lost their progress and gear day or 2 after my start. The server later went offline for nearly 2 days due to maintenance and there was another disruption of service for all users due to crashed login verification server. Why is this important? Most paid features seems to be time limited, which might be problematic if you pay for patron access or somethign similar and you cant play.

Bad, Ugly...Microtransactions
I want to comment on the payment/microtransaction model and the way game is designed around it. I will say it upfront that I have not explored all of options nor experienced complete game, I decided to stop playing before I could do so.

Unfortunately, this game resembles mobile free-to-play games in its design that is made to purposefuly annoy players and force them to buy microtransactions. This is something I'm not willing to tolerate on PC titles. I want to enjoy games, not being annoyed by them knowing such annoyance is done on purpose.
The game has paid transportation system with ingame currency but you soon realize it is very pricey for amount of ingame currency you earn, at least at start. Your free teleport to city/village is on 30 minutes cooldown on free account, 10 seconds on patron paid account. Your inventory is extremely limited to the point you either ignore loot, salvage it (which costs huge amount of ingame currency if you are a starter and you get lot of loot as you progress) or spend unholy amount of time traveling to nearest merchant and back to your grinding location. You have storage space in cities/villages, which can be accessed remotely--you get free trial for 7 days, after which you must pay for it. Given how small your inventory is, it is nearly mandatory to buy remote warehouse access (patron account). I almost forgot to mention you cant send email from free account, supposedly to prevent spamming and scamming as explained by the deveoper...

Conclusion, TLDR
I have spent 1000s of hours playing Path of Exile, which has one of best and most fair microtransaction models, therefore, I know  free to play games can be enjoyable. I have spent 100s of hours in paid for ARPG titles, which were mostly worth their price with few misses here and there. Devilian did not convince me to spend my hard earned cash on the game. In fact and to my surprise, the game did not even try to entice me and drag me into its world. Restriction are ever present from very start, the game design focused on pushing you to spend money on microtransaction. Quests are bland and uninspiring to a point where you dont read the flavor text and just auto-run (game feature) to location where you kill stuff.

I can not recommend this game for people that are looking for next ARPG title either seeking novelty, refreshment or just to kill some time. There are better alternatives on the market in both paid for and free to play categories.

reviewText:
I played this game for 20 minutes as part of a First Impressions series I do on Steam F2Ps for my YouTube channel.

Usually I play for 20 minutes and have no desire to play ever again, but Devilian left me interested enough to want to go back and play it again at some point. I love the combat and dungeon-crawler aspect to it. the game looks great, and it has a certain charm about it that I like. From what I understand the game has a lot of social stuff locked until you get verified by paying for something, but I'd come back to play Devilian just as a solo, Diablo-style experience.

I don't know, to be honest. My impressions in the 20 minutes I played tell me to recommend the game, and so this review will be subject to change if and when I come back to play it longer.

reviewText:
1st impressions... so I got to the castle, felt like it was a background ripped from the final act in Diablo III (the heaven part), with a character I made in Continent of the Ninth Seal super jigglin boobies every step you take, probably one of this game's brightest features right there, and I had spells (enchantress i think or caster class- female was only option for that class i think, very little in the way of custom look- small handful anyway,  and with spells kinda like something from Path of Exile only a little beefed up from that.. spells feel awesome and shoot really fast until you run out of sp... feels awesome there- like old school nintendo game fun in a good way but lacking a certain element or three to make it perfectly gel together as far as movement goes.  this would be uber awesome if you guys made it into a 2 Dimensional side-scrolling game and let me use a joystick, then there'd be  no need to go all crazy with (god forbid) something like MOUSE LOOK MODE (!!!) ha ha or even a way to turn the dang camera angle by like clicking and dragging with the mouse, nope

now hear me out...  the old school isometric top down games of the past that ruled like Final Fantasy Tactics and Fallout Tactics you didn't really need to turn the camera because mainly it was turn based and you weren't shoved out there with this body expected to run sideways and dash to the left and right  and up and down and blast enemies that come from all four directions at once, often i found my lightning bolt firing off the wrong way (is there a way to target your enemy? could you make at least an auto lock (which could be toggled with a hotkey) on nearby targets you're facing or something for when i'm shooting towards the camera while facing it?? please.)   the artwork i like, holy wow transform into winged super nekkid devil lady with jigglin' boobies ohh yeahhh, sweet, and spells get different in devil mode kool yes

fun fast button masher not really an RPG at all except there's maybe some backstory or something and you fight lesser mobs which constantly respawn in regular zones leading up to a boss in a cave and loot equip, pick a couple new spells when you level up not really a whole lot of options there so far, get the next one the next ok.  lol whipped through to about level 19 in what felt like a couple hours kinda semi addictive possibililties, seemed like less of a chance for Trion to totally screw over frree to play like they did with Archeage by creating such a messed up labor system that will not give me enough labor (as a free to play) to complete the level 50+ quests to make an obsidian weapon.  Devilian... think side scroller hack and slash fun times especially if you play with other players maybe but Devilian, you should have taken more notes from Symphony of the Night. ya no need for camera mode revamp if you just make a patch that creates a nice autolock-on feature to help actually hit the enemies because I am having a difficult time aiming my spells at the enemies and like say my lightning bolt has ten seconds on cooldown or something it keeps shooting the wrong way helllppp ppllleeaaassee ;p

Final first look analysis: ok it looks kool pretty much like the art makes me feel like I'm doing Dark Blood Online which is nice since Dark Blood went Offline (sad face, also Dark Blood allowed joystick controll btw)  yeah can't knock this ♥♥♥♥ if they're giving it away right? well guess again! i friggin hate the dang christmas music in the castle, turn that $%% the hell off! I'm gonna go play some of these other games i can kick back and use the controller on until the xmas is over and you update that, plenty other awesome games, I recommend checking out Snail's new Black Gold Online also for free to play, the guys who made Age of Wushu did something crazy with flying dragon mounts and robots and there is a mouse look / camera turn function to look at the slightly buggy beautiful artworks in high detail with a new custom designed and self built mid atx tower I have decided to call her The Stealth Ninja Assassin 5000 it's a beast and quiet as hell xD coming for you in the dead of night so sleep tight

reviewText:
PROS

- Fast paced: You'll get max level in like 4 days of gameplay.
- Easy quests: You don't even need to read text bubbles you have a built-in quest helper and a highlighted map.
- Easy leveling system: Every class has 3 trees, you pick one and follow it.
- Dungeons are built decently: Every boss is different and has their own unique mechanics.
- Dungeon reward system is a nice touch: Give you extra items for finishing a dungeon fast or not dying much.

CONS

- Paywall: I'm not saying you have to spend money to make your character better, but it makes it easier. Without a patron account (You have to spend $5 in game every 30 days) you can only accept trade offers not initiate them. You can spend money in the Auction House but can't place anything in it. Your in-game megaphone which allows you to make announcements to find groups, sell items etc... doesn't work. And lastly you can read your in-game mail but can't compose and send anything.
- Limited Inventory Space: first inventory expansion ticket is a quest reward but the rest of them will cost you surprise surprise.
- No Story Plot: You're a half-demon fighting full demons, basically what I've summed up, I didn't read the lore because it's really boring.
- No Endgame: Just grind gems, talismans and run the same dungeons until you're blue in the face.
- Lag spikes and server drops: There are a lot of them, especially durning boss fights, if every thing stops moving but you, just run in a circle and spam healing spells and pots and hope you aren't dead by the time the game catches up, or it will just boot you and you have to run it again.
- PvP is a joke: Spam CC or out-range somebody and win.
voteText: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
You know...you think you have found a fun game that allows you to jump in and play with a fried for an hour or so and doesn't feel like a job...UNTIL....*drum roll*...you see the ever popular and much hated, mobile game driven  DAILY LOGIN REWARD!!  This system is one of the worst systems created by game developers and is squarely aimed at driving revenue up by forcing the player base to at least login daily or miss out on gifts and goodies.  Now, the counter argument is that nearly every game has a system like this and I don't disagree.  But what makes other systems not so despised is that they incent and reward, not penalize.  What do I mean?  Daileys of any sort reward the player who commits to doing them, but you don't lose anything for not doing them.  It may accelerate your acquisition of skills or gear, but it doesn't stick a carrot in front of your face to pull it away as your mouth gets within chomping distance.  Devlian's login reward system penalizes you for missing a day of activity.  That is, the 7 day, 14 day or 21 day rewards require consecutive logins.  Work late one night and miss the login...*WHAMMIE*   Get sick and don't play one day...*WHAMMIE*  Forget?  *WHAMMIE*.  Go away on vacation...*DOUBLE WHAMMIE*.

Take a lesson from all top grossing games...none of them has a penalty system for not logging in that is so in your face.  Clash of Clans, the king of mobile games doesn't, but you do stand to lose resources if you don't collect/spend them as you'll be attacked.  Top MMO of 2015, ESO, has daily writs to accelerate your crafting skills and daily Undaunted Pledges (dungeons) but that too just accelerates.  It doesn't penalize.

When devs do this, I leave.  Why?  Simple...they admit to not being confident that their game will hold a player's attention and thus need a required daily login system, the carrot and stick, to attempt to retain a player base.

There are so many games to choose from these days, my time AND money goes to the confident developers who let their content stand for itself.
voteText: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Wasn't sure if I was going to bother write a review for this crap, but what the heck. I'm a big fan of the ARPG-genre, and yes, I even enjoyed Diablo 3 quite a lot. Path of Exile, Marvel Heroes, Torchlight 1 and 2, Sacred 1 and 2, they are all very good games. When I first found this game, I wasn't sure what to expect, but I set my hopes to very low. And know what? I was still disappointed.

Where do we even begin? The characters are as generic as they get. Monsters and levels? Boring as hell. Been there, done that. The MMO-bit? Pointless. Gathering loot? I didn't see the point. The ARPG-genre is pretty much built around gathering loot, and when even that failed, I didn't see much hope for this game. It would be like a FPS-game without guns. Or a racing game where you race around in shopping carts. Actually, that would have been a lot of fun. Racing downhill in a shopping carts, SSX style. Brilliant, but so not the point here.

I've made it to three hours in this game, and that's three hours I honestly think I wasted. But if that means you won't, it was worth it. I'm nice like that, hehe.

reviewText: Very Very Good Game, at times there are issues but nothing too major for me , it is what Diablo 3 should be like, it has many modes of PVP including zone captures, rifts and Devil Hunts, tons of PVE Dungeons and events/World bosses, A Talisman card system, a decent population (it should be bigger however), Ignore all the haters, this is a must try for anybody who like ARPG, sure the game has some issues but i have been hooked for ages now, it is not pay to win, but progress can be achieved quicker and you can buy better level enchants if you have a lot of gold, which is where the game tries to cap players off from advancing to fast.. give it a try, you may just love it!

reviewText:
At first I was skeptical since I have played Path of Exile and Diablo 3 for more than a few hours now. When I played Devilian in the beta it felt refreshing and just like Diablo 3 but with a twist *MMO* style gameplay. This game IMO isn't a new take on ARPGs but just and update for the fans that have wanted the massive player base and feel of persistence from this genre.

If you enjoy ARPGs you should try Devilian out (it is free after all) and see if it is your cup of tea.

Enjoy.

reviewText:
An action MMO that really nails combat and avoids the endless repetitive content of most ARPGs. Set layout dungeons with well designed bosses that aren't just three attacks are really a thing I'm surprised more ARPGs haven't borrowed from the MMO model, and are great fun.

Also real, balanced and fun PVP with ARPG gameplay. Even D3 hasn't managed to try to make that happen.

I'd recommend playing to at least level 30 before deciding fully, the difficulty is slower to ramp but once it does the game becomes excellent.

reviewText: First off don't pay attention to time played I played this game in beta before it came to steam.\n\nThis game is very similar to Diablo and PoE (Path of Exile). It falls somewhere in between. There are quest to be done and It is not quite as linear as Diablo but most certainly not as in depth as PoE. The skill tree is simple yet allows diversity between two people playing the same class. There are a lot of elements of this game that fit the stereotypical MMORPG, however there are enough new and different things about it that are very enjoyable. If you are looking for an MMORPG that is free and has interesting combat to it this not a bad one to try.

reviewText: I am addicted to Trions games, 5k hours in RIFT which has been the best MMO ive ever played 1k in Archeage and now this comes out, 8 hours in so far and its been a blast leveling with friends, game is pretty fast paced as theres a short journey between quests and everyone deals tons of damage so balancing seems to be good enough early game but cant comment on endgame yet but there are dungeons, so this is like a mmo/arpg hybrid. The gem store isnt really p2w as its the same as in every Trion game you can buy cosmetics and like boosts but those arent really necessary for winning the game"
date: nothing you find in the gem store gives you power but the gem store is quite lacking atm so save your gems for some swagger mounts straight from the RIFT mount collection. It even has PVP which i wont try untill max level. There is lots of completion to be had here since there are really many titles you can earn from special achievements and other rewards for daily challenges etc. If you have ever liked any arpg or mmo with grinding i think you should try this as its f2p so you have nothing to lose. Auto run is pretty stupid though so you will probably never explore the world yourself
recommended: hit auto run kill mobs repeatx999 but thats the grindy part. The leveling part is actually far too easy but so is every mmos leveling phase but a casual fun game can be good to play every now and then

And most of the negative reviews here are because people are afraid of 3rd party launchers which is stupid and pointless and because of people think its a f2p p2w game which is very incorrect."

reviewText:
I'll put the tl;dr first so you get my point, if you want detailed explanation keep reading.

TL;DR:
- Alright game but very average generic and repetitive.
- Trion managed to ♥♥♥♥ up in the first few days already, doesn't inspire trust for the future.
- Cash shop isn't cosmetic and/or minor convenience only like gw2 lol path of exile. You can buy power in many ways and you will have to spend money to be competitive (your account will have locked features unless you at least buy something for starters) it's just not the worse kind (still bad), and you can buy from other players for in game gold, think like your usual gameforge Cash shop (aion tera).

So first of all this game isn't bad, but is it good ?
Well it's alright i guess, but the thing is every single thing about it is terribly generic, skins, quests, skills, specs, content.
Every single thing in this game is your average generic mmo content you've seen a thousand time before.
All of those things are ok no more no less, there isn't one single thing to set it apart from your average crowd.

The game is teribly easy, and i checked on friends that actually like the game enough to get to end game" and it will never ever get "hard" mechanicaly speaking. Same fights

reviewText:
People can have there own opinion ofcourse, but most reviews on Steam I have read are not giving the right informations.

- Is it Gender locked? Yes it is but so are many other games like Diablo 2 and modern mmorpgs like Tera where certain classes are gender locked.
- Is it P2W? Yes it is in some way, but you can buy DEX from other players for in game money that allows you to buy anything in cash shop.

- Then people are complaining that it does not run smooth and that the game in clunky. This is far from true unless you run it on a potatoe, the animations are amazing, the boss fights are very intresting.
- The game is far from flawless, but its a fun to play ARPG with MMO elemens. Its free and you can ofcourse always download it and see for your self.
- So far the Cash shop does not give you a huge advantage, its there yes and you will get stronger then others if you use it, I myself are a very compedetive person and I don't like games where you have to spent 100s of dollars to compete, but so far I have not felt anoyed by it. Normaly I find myself buying a lot of items in P2W games, and I have 30 dollars on my Steam account that I don't know where to spent on in game (which is good in my opinion)

I rate it a 8.5/10 (at this moment)

reviewText: If you've played any Korean MMOs, you'll find this game depressingly familiar. From the generic art style to the spam-click fest combat to the tonally vacant and oppressively derivative fantasy story, there's little here that stands out or knows how to engage the player. There's no feeling of accomplishment, of place in the world, or of narative weight as the game ram-rods you through its content. Enemies, even bosses, respawn so fast that there's never a moment when you aren't surrounded by them. But don't worry- they're practically harmless.  It's an empty, ungratifying experience.

My pros:
--------------------

1) The framerate stayed constantly smooth at 60 fps.

2) It looks pretty.

3) The loot system isn't super insane so you don't end up with like fifty things of the same chestplate right at the beginning of the game.

4) The combat is really fluid.

5) Hits feel impactful so it feels like you're actually doing something.

6) They know there are people who like WASD versus mouse clicking so they included both movement types. This isn't exactly innovative but it's nice they did it.

7) It's pretty easy to start a party, add a friend, and play together.

8) The classes aren't ridiculous like other fantasy MMORPGs.



My cons:
--------------------

1) It can be intimidating at first, there's a lot of information that pops up suddenly when you're in town.

2) The enemies seem more like training dummies than enemies (at least in the lower levels).

3) The training area pretty much overpowers your character for the first town so it feels less like you're being involved in the game's progression and more like you're being taken for a ride.

4) The game can crash without real warning. I think I hit J when it crashed the one time it happened to me. I haven't lost any progress or items after crashing but some people have claimed to so be careful.

5) There's only four classes and each is gender/race locked. So if you want to be a ranged character either you're a female mage or a loli sharpshooter. That doesn't detract from the overall experience as much, but this can be a turn-off for some people.



The verdict:
--------------------

If you're not used to Diablo-esque games this can be intimidating, at first. But if you give it a chance and take it all in it can be quite fun, especially with friends. If you have a decent enough PC the game can look really good as well as run at a solid 60fps. The actual combat, however fluid, can be kind of boring. But it's always satisfying as a mage to send out a fireball and kill five crabs at once and see their bodies fly away in all directions. If you're a fan of Diablo 3, this game should feel similar. And for those of you who like Diablo but can't afford Diablo 3, this is a good free alternative.

reviewText:
First of all, I'm big diablo fan. I finished diablo 1, diablo 2, diablo 3. Also i played Lineage and MU online (korean games).

What i'm trying to say is, that i like this game, because it seems like mixture of all my mentioned games. It's MMOARPG. Of course it's a grindy game, but somehow it's very addictive, fun to play & kill time. Just completely ignore story line and play the game you should like it, because i think end game PvP should be fun. Also this game is not P2W as far as i know, its just Pay For Convenience (short cuts in-game, no added advantages).

To sum up, remember that this game is free, so don't judge it too much. It's worth to give it a shot. Just try for yourself maybe you will like it, because i definitelly enjoying it. I rate 8.5/10

reviewText: Every so often, a game comes along that takes a bit of other, more popular games, stitches it together, and pushes it out into the public. However, just because you can crib from other games, it doesn't make the game fun.\n\nThis game tries it's best to be Diablo III with a distinctively Trion/RIFT artstyle. The problem is that the game itself tends to try too hard to cosplay as other games without actually bringing anything new. I know people hate F2P/Pay2Win -- and really, $75 of DLC is a bit excessive, and that's before you even get into the in-game store for consumables, pets, and cosmetics -- but the game IS actually fun. For a bit. Like every TRION game, it's fun as a new experience, but it eventually fades to a distinct meh." Once boredom sets in

reviewText:
When I stumbled on Devilian I had absolutely no expectations. It was a Friday night, I was bored, kids were in  bed and looking to kill an hour or two. I'd heard a bit about the game, but knew next to nothing and frankly never intended to play more than a couple minutes of it.

All of a sudden it's been 40+ hours and I'm amazed and having a blast.

While this gets compared to D3 or Path of Exile, it really is nothing like these games. In some many ways this is finally the ARPG I've been waiting for.

I play with a Steam Controller, and it works like a charm. Once again, almost exactly what I have been looking for. Look the game is a bit grindy I guess, and the narrative is nothing to get excited about, but the gameplay is just pure fun.

At the end of the day what keeps me playing is just running and killing and leveling and looking forward to gearing up because it's just plain fun. I never enjoyed the click clicking of PoE or D3 all that much. They might have a better storyline or a bit more depth to character development, but none of that matters if it's not fun.

And this game is.

There's just so much here and after you get past the first couple hours, the game world opens up and there's more depth than I had ever expected.

reviewText:
It's easy to be a turd and just rag on Trion, so I won't bother.  They know what they did and are suffering for it, so I don't need to put into words how much I dislike them.  I'm actually going to write a review about the game, not the devs or anyone else because I believe that is what the reviews are really for.  Not circle jerking in anger about anything else.

Good:
Graphics are great
active community
combat is satisfying as melee & range/magic
music is great
atmosphere is usually spooky which I love
talents to personalize the types of attacks you will make as well as modify the talents themselves with passive upgrades
auto-run (yes, I actually love this)
very fun, addictive gameplay

Bad:
Only 2 character slots available
character customization is kind of eh, but for this kind of game it really doesn't matter IMO
gender locked classes, I really hate that in any game
this is nothing new, it has been done before, this is basically Path of Exil + DII/DIII with a bit of Aion look to it
Yes, it's Trion.  The people that ruined ArcheAge.  And I mean R-U-I-N-E-D.
(Ok, I know I said I wouldn't rag on them but I actually paid to be a founder for that game which I -NEVER- do and I loved it so much and they just took it to an orgy in a filthy hobbo town where no one wants to be let alone give money to.)

-------------------------
tl;dr it's fun, it isn't anything new but it is a very fun distraction/time killer.  I saw no huge problems with bots OR spammers, I had no problem playing, leveling up, doing dungeons, etc. because the game never asked me for anything after I logged in.
I think the people screaming their mincy little heads about it are either lying or incredibly stupid.  It's just a 'been there, done that' type of game that is easy to play while you watch Netflix on your tablet.

It's easy to be a turd and just rag on Trion, so I won't bother.  They know what they did and are suffering for it, so I don't need to put into words how much I dislike them.  I'm actually going to write a review about the game, not the devs or anyone else because I believe that is what the reviews are really for.  Not circle jerking in anger about anything else.

Good:
Graphics are great
active community
combat is satisfying as melee & range/magic
music is great
atmosphere is usually spooky which I love
talents to personalize the types of attacks you will make as well as modify the talents themselves with passive upgrades
auto-run (yes, I actually love this)
very fun, addictive gameplay

Bad:
Only 2 character slots available
character customization is kind of eh, but for this kind of game it really doesn't matter IMO
gender locked classes, I really hate that in any game
this is nothing new, it has been done before, this is basically Path of Exil + DII/DIII with a bit of Aion look to it
Yes, it's Trion.  The people that ruined ArcheAge.  And I mean R-U-I-N-E-D.
(Ok, I know I said I wouldn't rag on them but I actually paid to be a founder for that game which I -NEVER- do and I loved it so much and they just took it to an orgy in a filthy hobbo town where no one wants to be let alone give money to.)

-------------------------
tl;dr it's fun, it isn't anything new but it is a very fun distraction/time killer.  I saw no huge problems with bots OR spammers, I had no problem playing, leveling up, doing dungeons, etc. because the game never asked me for anything after I logged in.
I think the people screaming their mincy little heads about it are either lying or incredibly stupid.  It's just a 'been there, done that' type of game that is easy to play while you watch Netflix on your tablet.

reviewText:
I recommend this as a free-to-play game only--it's an interesting diversion that plays very similarly to Diablo 3.

There are a few oddities, the first of which you'll encounter is gender-locked classes (and only 4 of them at that). There's very little character customization and the game allows you to freely change your skill trees at will with no penalty, so you certainly won't get too attached to your character.

The quests are straightforward and leveling is QUICK--it'll take you 30 hours or less to hit max level. There are a few interesting dungeon mechanics I haven't seen before but there's nothing groundbreaking in this game. This is an MMO-lite; play for fun, when you need a diversion from a heavier game, or something to play with a friend when you don't want to spend a dime.

I haven't (and won't) spent any cash on this game though I have purchased something from Trion in the past; my understanding is that if you haven't you can't access even the auction house. The only thing tempting to purchase is more inventory space as you start with so little it's almost painful.

This could be a much more interesting game, but as I said, it's an MMO-lite. Light on customization, light on content, light on difficulty. Some strange choices like the gender-locked classes, at will skill changes, and the inability to click on your skills to use them (you must use the numbered hotkeys). Devilian mode is also shockingly weak, making it less of an interesting aspect of the game and more of a strange add-on that the game could do without.

Perhaps in a year this game will have had a lot more content added and become something more than what it is now, but for now, play as a diversion when you're waiting for something else to come along.

Ill keep it short,

The game is just another Korean grind fest, what does this mean? Ok so you click the auto run button move to an npc hit the F key to take quest then click autorun agian to move to an area kill stuff then click automove agian to turn in the quest.  You do this forever and that is the game.

This game is p2w meaning paying players get far more advanced then non paying players. just like Archage online.  So if your run of the mill Korean grinder you have to pay for sounds like something u like get this game

reviewText: After about 30 hours in the game I have to say the game I believe is worth checking out, obviously there are going to be haters.... its the internet! Most I would assume are bent out of shape Blizztards who fan boy out about Diablo 3. Dont get me wrong I play D3 just as much as the next and love it but I am open minded when it comes to other games in this genre.\nI felt the game was more MMO than RPG, the combat felt more MMO styled instead of more like Diablo for instance, its still fun but a little slow for my tastes. The game seems very well put together and has great graphics, though the voices when spoken dont have mouth movements to go along with it. not sure if that is something that will be added later or thats just how it is? I thought having more than 4 main skills/attacks was nice unlike other RPG's, it seems to be more advanced in  that area, the skill trees are easy to understand and use. It seems the crafting system is very complex though and very deep, atleast as much as I could get into it so far. All in all I think this game has alot of potential and should be looked at for its pros and not picked apart for every con you can find. Now a days the bar has been set so high for games but remember this is made by Bluehole Studios which I believe is more indie and not something big like Blizzard, etc.  I think its a great FTP game and everyone should give it a try!

reviewText:
Thought the game was boring and a cash grab, but it was pretty great.

The game doesn't force you to pay for skill reset at all it gives you infinite reset right in your skill menu so you can change build whenever you want! unlike many mmo which force you to pay real cash for a skill reset scroll.

No cash? no problem it seems you buy these thing call DEX(use to get credit, 1 dex gives you 1250 credits) from other players from auction trader, these seems to drop or given as reward from dungeon(could be wrong) or from boxes, the Dex are dropping in price and aren't expensive at all around 50g each.

Grinding for gold in the game is pretty easy you get around 100g by the time you reach max level just from story quest line and dungeons, sometime you may even get lucky and boss may drop like 10g or so( final boss in one of the lv20 dungeon drop me 20g was so happy!).

There is not much grinding you can easily reach max level under 12hrs, but you can keep grinding for proficency points after meeting max level!

The pvp isn't bad its kinda fun but damn waiting for people to join for any of the pvp arena is like waiting on the highway after they close of all the lanes leaving only 1 lane open!

And like all mmo the bugs are real they bug crawl everywhere but its only minor nothing breaking like >insert bad mmo with super bad launch<.

Great game if you like Diablo 2 and Path of Exile.

PS. there is a cannon shooting loli class if that makes any difference at all for you!

reviewText:
No hours on steam because I started playing this exclusively through glyph, not knowing it was even on steam. I played the alpha, and currently have a level 30 in the game.

Despite the negative reviews here on Steam, this game really isn't bad. Playing this game with a friend or two is enjoyable, and it could be enjoyable for anyone who liked the click-and-kill playstyle of Torchlight or Diablo. Of course, this game doesn't offer the depth that Diablo does (it's a F2P MMO ARPG), and there's really no point in reading the quest logs or trying to follow the story (the voice acting is bad, and the story is just another fantasy do-gooder story). But there's a good bit of content to the game. Leveling is not that bad of a grind compared to other F2P games like TERA, and the zones change graphically and consistently. Each zone has something unique about it, which is refreshing, and there is a variation to the monsters within the game. The quests also have variations, changing from kill quests, to collect quests, to dungeons, and to doing A-then-B. But really, how much questing variation can there be in a top-down MMO?

It's also not pay to win"

reviewText:
Welcome!
To the game that requires an update of 7Gbs within the first week of it's officla release.
Also to the game where the character mouths don't move when they speak.

//Skip To The End For Pros And Cons

All jokes asside now. This game is a very good MMO. Yes, maybe you can't choose your gender nor race but atleast you get to personnalise your character a bit.

The things a like the most in this MMO is the fighting. I heard some people say it's too mechanic or something like that but it isn't at all. It's fluid and pretty cool. But it can be buggy sometimes. Like, you get hit but you are not within their hitting zone.

People have been saying that it's a P2W game. It isn't. Don't listen to them. I've played a good couple of hours and I haven't came across any real money deals yet.... yet. I do know that you can have 2 characters and then you have to pay to get more and also pay to get more inventory slots but at the same time. The devs have got to make a living! It's not like you have to buy the game for 50£ or $ or whatever. Anyway if you on't want to pay anything. Do what I do and ignore it. This isn't SWTOR where you have to pay money just to get the good gear.

Now for the pros and cons.

Pros:
+Good Graphics
+Fluid Combat Mechanics
+Borderlands Style Skill Tree
+It Doesn't Get Boring Questing (For Some It Might)
+Unique Second Form System And Point System
+A Much Needed AutoRun To Quests

Cons:
-Characters Mouths Are Immobile
-Genders Are Locked (Not that Big Of A Problem)
-Can Be Buggy At Some Points
-Rare Bugs With Hits

P.S. If any one of you feels affended by women wearing almost nothing (Yes, apparently people do get affended by that. I don't know how they cope in the bedroom) then... Don't play this game.

8/10 (For the combat bugs) Would play and recommend again!

reviewText: After about 30 hours in the game I have to say the game I believe is worth checking out, obviously there are going to be haters.... its the internet! Most I would assume are bent out of shape Blizztards who fan boy out about Diablo 3. Dont get me wrong I play D3 just as much as the next and love it but I am open minded when it comes to other games in this genre.\nI felt the game was more MMO than RPG, the combat felt more MMO styled instead of more like Diablo for instance, its still fun but a little slow for my tastes. The game seems very well put together and has great graphics, though the voices when spoken dont have mouth movements to go along with it. not sure if that is something that will be added later or thats just how it is? I thought having more than 4 main skills/attacks was nice unlike other RPG's, it seems to be more advanced in  that area, the skill trees are easy to understand and use. It seems the crafting system is very complex though and very deep, atleast as much as I could get into it so far. All in all I think this game has alot of potential and should be looked at for its pros and not picked apart for every con you can find. Now a days the bar has been set so high for games but remember this is made by Bluehole Studios which I believe is more indie and not something big like Blizzard, etc.  I think its a great FTP game and everyone should give it a try!

reviewText: Devilian is a free to play MMO that is all about questing, leveling, finding and tuning equipment, doing dungeons in parties, teaming up in guilds and having fun. The game ist still in beta but already very enjoyable. The support is extremely fast and professional, while it is possible to improve aspects of the progress (like inventory size, mounts and small boosts) it is a true free to play game, free of pay 2 win aspects. The DLCs however are absolutely worth considering, the basic one contains 16 inventory slots and a 3 day booster.

reviewText:
I recommend this as a free-to-play game only--it's an interesting diversion that plays very similarly to Diablo 3.

There are a few oddities, the first of which you'll encounter is gender-locked classes (and only 4 of them at that). There's very little character customization and the game allows you to freely change your skill trees at will with no penalty, so you certainly won't get too attached to your character.

The quests are straightforward and leveling is QUICK--it'll take you 30 hours or less to hit max level. There are a few interesting dungeon mechanics I haven't seen before but there's nothing groundbreaking in this game. This is an MMO-lite; play for fun, when you need a diversion from a heavier game, or something to play with a friend when you don't want to spend a dime.

I haven't (and won't) spent any cash on this game though I have purchased something from Trion in the past; my understanding is that if you haven't you can't access even the auction house. The only thing tempting to purchase is more inventory space as you start with so little it's almost painful.

This could be a much more interesting game, but as I said, it's an MMO-lite. Light on customization, light on content, light on difficulty. Some strange choices like the gender-locked classes, at will skill changes, and the inability to click on your skills to use them (you must use the numbered hotkeys). Devilian mode is also shockingly weak, making it less of an interesting aspect of the game and more of a strange add-on that the game could do without.

Perhaps in a year this game will have had a lot more content added and become something more than what it is now, but for now, play as a diversion when you're waiting for something else to come along.

reviewText:
Having played Diablo 1-3, Path of Exile and many numerous Action RPGs, I was excited to play Devilian.

The Good:
Fun, solid dungeon crawling gameplay that will be familiar to many. Rewarding and smooth combat.

The Bad:
However, several hours into the game I was greatly disappointed by this game due to poor class balancing and total negligence from Trion to  the ingame community (this was to be expected, seeing what Trion did to ArcheAge). Addressing the poor class balancing, Evokers and Cannoneers dominate the rankings in PVE and PVP, if you play anything other than these classes; expect to struggle in the long-run. The devs did announce to rebalance the game in one of their streams sometime in January, however that is all unknown at this point seeing how Trion historically handled it's other once popular MMOs. The game itself has few hiccups, and at times can be laggy. You're also limited to just creating two characters, and will need to purchase slots from the cash shop.

Lastly, gearing up in the higher levels is an absolute pain, currently butchery gear is the best in the game and has an incredibly low drop rate.

Conclusion:
With the game being the way it is now, I cannot recommend this game to casual players let alone hardcore players. It is not worth your time in the long-run

reviewText:
Do you like cut scenes that look like someone colorized an 8 year old's Etch-a-sketch?
How about voice overs that sound like they're bored game devs who couldn't afford a decent voice actor?
Game play that feels a 10 year old's interpretation of a game reviewer's rant about badly made isometric action RPGs?

If you do, then welcome to Devilian, the first Diablo clone that is 100% pay-to-win, made by the master conmen of shoddy MMOs, Trion. Now that Trion has killed their P2W minecraft knock off, Trove, and their P2W WoW knock off, Archeage, they're trying to copy Path of Exile and go for the hattrick of poor game design. Devilian will set you back 100x more than either Path of Exile and Diablo 3 for strictly inferior gameplay. Devilian even makes the single player, bug ridden Sacred 1 look positively glowing. Save yourself money and frustration, and spend your money on a game and a publisher that deserves it.

reviewText:
Only played for a couple of minutes and I have only one thing to say: this game feels so lifeless. It has absolutely nothing different from Diablo or PoE except that it looks anime-style.

Quests are by default boring: go kill that, go talk to that. Period.

It is really hard for me to understand how you can keep going on like this until max level, grind all the gear you need and PVP for extra grind without getting bored a few minutes into the game.

What's the endgame? What is Devilian promising? Adventure? There sure isn't one. Grinding? There are already tons of games promising that. Glory? Every game on the market is promising that. There isn't anything special about this game. It's just a rework.

Sorry, I really wanted to post something better, but there is nothing else to say.

reviewText:
Pretty Good

It's a fun game for awhile, but gets very repetitive quickly. This game has awesome effects and style, but you'll find yourself farming the same dungeon all day. Items that drop have random stats, which is good in my opinion, but you'll also find yourself spamming the same skill all the time. Though there are many skills for each character, most of them are just not as powerful as some other skills, so many people would be using the same skill set as you may be. All in all, this game gets boring real quick, though you may at least spend some time on it. It is free after all

reviewText:
Important Note: I once got a beta key for Devilian. I only installed it via Steam so I could write a review here. The time displayed here does not represent the time I have actually played the game.

I can't understand how so many people like this game. But I guess it's because MMORPG player don't have high standards...
That's the only explanation I have.

So, when I started the game, I was greated with an object, eh, I mean 'woman' with breast plate and what's even worse: bouncing boobs.

Yay! Another game that treats me as if I'm a pubertal white young male that will be a virgin forever! But what did I expect? From the developers of TERA...

Nice. Well, I know how MMOs are. I gave it a chance. A game can have flaws but can still be enjoyable.

But the next thing wasn't great either.

When in the character creation, your gender depends on which class you choose. On top of it, there's even a class were you play as a little girl, for those pedophiles MMORPG developers like to pander.

I choose the shadowhunter, as it was the most interesting class for me (and because I didn't wan't to play as an object.)
The other classes where Berserker, Magician and Gunner I think. Nothing new here.

Then there was a tutorial level, in which an object, eh, I mean 'woman' helped me. Said woman gets kidnapped, we get another object as a companion to rescue the woman who was our company before, then she moaned in a manner where
I thought again 'I'm not 12 years old!' and that was all what had to be done in this completely unnecessary tutorial level.

Unnecessary because the game is extremly easy. Just smash your head on your keybeard.

After that the player gets to Tristam. Eh, I mean, some town resembling Tristam a tiny bit, because Devilian copied Diablo, eh, I mean they were 'influenced' by Diablo...

Well, and here begins the typical looting, leveling and grinding part.

The fights are actually kinda fun, but much too easy and boring.

At the end of the day Devilian is really not worth playing.

It's boring, has nothing new, is just like any other MMORPG out there and is in some aspects even worse.

So, if I want to play Diablo, then I play Diablo or similiar games like Sacred, Torchlight or Titan Quest.

And if I want to play MMORPGs then I rather play AION, Neverwinter, TESO, ArcheAge or Guild Wars 2.

But I surely don't want to waste my time with Devilian.

I also wrote a review on my tumblr, with some screenshots of said objects and some quotes to show what other people from the ingame chat said about this game.
It's here if you want to see it: http://jenny-jester.tumblr.com/post/134007245285

reviewText:
This game has a nice approach to the ARPG genre(Diablo) and Mmo genre (TERA), those two combined along with a ♥♥♥♥ publisher is what you call Devilian.

The game itself definately has potential, however it has some flaws regarding the marketplace and certain publisher priorities.
Expect a classic trion approach to this mmoarpg, if you're willing to look past that this game is actually amazing.

Aside of the few bugs it's worth a try. I'll probably be logging in to this regularly until Lost Ark releases.

reviewText: After 46 hours played I can honestly say I've been enjoying the game quite a bit. The leveling curve starts off extremely quickly, and then slows down as you approach your 30's. Not too slow, and there is never a grind. It mixes the elements of a traditional ARPG and classic MMO together well. The only gripe is that it's supposed to be a Hybrid ARPG, but there isn't enough random loot. It's the typical asian mmo in that every piece of gear is tiered by levels" and they all have the exact same name. Instead of wasting time looking at all the gear
date: I wish they had an "of the xxxx" to know what kind of stat allocation was on the piece of gear. I really love that each class has 3 tree's to go in and every single one of them have their uses. Being able to respec for free at anytime is amazing
recommended: even while out in the field.\n\nSo far I haven't found the need to spend any money at all. The negative reviews I read about this game kind of was putting me off
hoursPlayed: but I don't see anything at all in regards to what people's complaints are. Of course theirs going to be a grind at 52 to get the best gear
voteText: kind of part of ANY MMO and ARPG alike. Ever played Diablo and done 500+ gear runs to finally get 1 piece of useful upgrade. It's what draws us players to these types of games. Dungeons are very quick and rewarding
helpfulPercent: and earning tokens in previous area's don't go to waste if you have extras as you can spend 3 tokens to get 2 for the next area allowing you to progress gear wise while leveling very easily. The bosses in the dungeons while not "hard" have fun mechanics and makes everything seem like a controlled chaos. The animations
votesHelpful: and the combat are what make this game flat out amazing. I'm playing with my 8 year old and he loves the game
votesTotal: and my wife who typically stays away from mmo's wants to play. The game draws you in quickly
votesFunny: I just got into the game for the first time a few days ago and already have 46 hours invested.\n\nIf you're looking for a great ARPG style game that's also an MMO
commentsCount: this is the game to check out. It seriously reminds me of Diablo 2
column16: but a constant player base running around
column17: rather than having to be on battle.net and find rooms. My only complaint is the chat system
column18: but it's typical for all asian mmo's. The need for microphones to talk in open channels is really bleh. I get why they do it
column19: but I'd rather deal with bot spammers than be hindered when I may have questions. My recommendations for keyboard settings is set to classic mmo using wasd
column20: and remove the ability to click to move and set your combo building to mouse 1. If you don't you end up spamming 1 18 million times an hour and gets very tiring. It's almost impossible with click to move to click on targets and attack on mouse click. The only way I found a way around it was to set shift+click to allow using mouse click without moving

reviewText:
Did write a long review, too long.

ARPG as an MMO, similar in gameplay to more well recognised names; it remains true to the genre
Free to Try, level cap for free, pay to get involved with community, can solo to level cap if desired
Personalisation is poor, your going to be in the same armour as most other people your level; standard character customisation options though which to be fair do just about enough, very ARPG
Gear does not require real money, invest a lot of time but I have seen a lot worse
Inventory space is too low, no currency or crafting tabs; everything in one bag & a warehouse/storage
real money to extend a 'characters' inventory, more storage space you can unlock with ingame rewards
Yes gender locked classes is a thing, dont see that changing given new class & how much work would need to be done on the gear (there is 2-3 sets per zone; common, drop/quest and dungeons)
To me the pay model seems fair especially as its a choice and the same gear is grindable
Crafting the parts to plug into your gear (like gems) is very long winded, should have set colour per instance but fluctuating/random drop amount; same for resistance goods (it might actually be as im just stock piling it for now)
persistant maps, may limit on some players replayability, I appreciate the maps as it feels like a civilisation built it
PVP has mixed levels together reguardles of gear, the system applies some balancing but not enough, I still went back for more even though I did poor to start with; work in groups, its an MMO ;)
can buy box keys with an ingame currency, not a main currency; I could afford 4 keys when hitting cap and that was by just playing not focusing on getting the currency
player base is a bit too low for how much content there is, some wait times get silly; it deserves more attention
limited to 2 character slots initially, can pick any original class
store purchases are delivered to a server mail box, only special rewards like beta rewards are available on multiple characters
Talisman cards (like a collectable sticker album that gives you buffs) is a nice touch, like most stuff if you want ken hard buffs your gonna have to roll your sleves up and be patient
Steam wallet connected, shouldnt need to be a point on here but not all games with a 3rd party launcher use it
