reviewText: I originally recommended this game, but now I'm changing it. If you play PvE mainly the game is fairly balanced. If you play PvP you cannot be competitive unless you spend hundreds of dollars on talisman boxes. I also hate the genderlocked classes. All in all it brings nothing new, although the PvP is fun but just requires too much money to be competitive. Also if you want to upgrade your artifacts you MUST buy a ton of enigma keys in order to MAYBE get a bunch of gems from an enigma box. Other than that it would take you literally years and years to find enough of the gems to upgrade your artifacts to anything past level 7. If not, you must sell DEV and then use that gold to pay for gems off the AH which are very expensive. Either way you are forced to pay a bunch of money to really be able to enjoy this  game more than a month or so.

reviewText:
First of all, i just played this game for an hour or so, so i know that my review is going to be very limited since i haven't experienced most of the game, but after just one hour i couldn't keep on playing because i was just getting bored and told my self that i could waste my time playing some other game.
Regarding the gameplay, Devilian is very similiar to games like Diablo, PoE, and Torchlight, beein an isometric hack 'n slash rpg. Move, smash some buttons to do the skills, kill the mobs, get the ocasiona loot, you know, that stuff.
The skills and animation aren't that bad either. I picked the chain-rogue like class (can't really remeber the name), and it had some really nice animation, with long chains and enormous blades coming out from my body. The gameplay itself didn't felt really smooth, it was always feeling like i'm moving a bit to slow than i should have done, always felt like my attacks were being delivered a fraction of second later than they should've done. I also had a dodge ability, with actually felt pretty useless since everytime i had to dodge an attack, the animation of my character felt to slow to actually manage to do it.
Also, while most of the MOARPG are usually instanced, this game actually had an 'open word-ish' map, which basically was just a slighty larger corridor than the usual dungeons that we usually see, and yeah, they were open world which meant that there were other players questing around you. And this, felt incredibly frustrating since being this an MOARPG, it's normal to clear big packs of mobs relatively quickly, so it was always a pain in the ♥♥♥ to manage to do that 'kill 5 generic mobs' quest, since i passed more time looking for the mobs instead of actually killing them (same for gathering quests). Also, the quests itself were really really generic, 'kill x mobs, gather x things, talk to x' and so on, being also that, atleast in the starting area, the mobs were always the same but slighty bigger or of a different color, so it really felt like doing the same thing over and over again.
Around lvl 10 (or 11, can't remember exactly) you get acces to the 'talents tree', where you have to pick from 3 specializations, only that it isn't really a tree, but most like a branch, since you are forced to pick one skill, and then you have the option to choose from which of 2 aspects of this skill upgrade (like -2 energy cost, or +10 damage).
Around lvl 12, i got to the first dungeon, in which i felt no difference at all from the normal questing area: it was just a long map, where i had to kill a bunch o mobs untill i got to the final boss. It wasn't even harder that the usual, but actually easier since i had an npc helping me.
So yeah, i got pretty bored of the game. It's not really bad, it's just REALLY generic.
Othervise than beeing a 'I don't recommend this game' review, this would actually be a very 'meh!' review

reviewText:
2 Words. Trion Worlds.

Perhaps the shadiest, greediest gaming company out there with the expection of Code}{atch - but by far the worst major studio in existence.

The game is bland, and uncreative - the classes are gender locked, and extremely limited progression customization or intial customization or anything really - It has the typical TW pay to win mechanics, and time-wasting feel.

Some of this could be blamed on the core developer Blue Hole - which being said, this feels like a watered down, top down TERA reboot - However, i still want to blame it all on TW, because they are mega-♥♥♥♥-holes.

reviewText:
What happens when you combine an Isometric Action RPG with an MMO? A game that almost works, but not quite. That is because one significant design choice reallt hurts the gameplay: Attacks Always Hit.
There are skill shots in the game, both friendly and hostile, and they are the attacks that hit like a truck, but alongside these skillshots are attacks that follow the target, and automatically hit, If anybody swings a sword, it doesn't matter if the target leaves melee distance, that melee attack hits. If a witch attacks you with a ranged attack, no amount of dodging will stop her homing missle of free damage.
This is a sacrifice made, I am assuming, to combat latency, allowing for the experience of an Isometric Action RPG with many people all over the world. But in my opinion this sacrifice was too high of a cost. I can ignore a bad story: not saying this has a bad story. I can look past an artistic direction I do not care for: not saying it looks bad. But I do not want to slug through unsatisfying gameplay, and to me, the introduction of auto-hit attacks makes the game unsatisfying.

As a Hardcore (Perma-death) Diablo player, this made the gameplay unsatisfying. The rest of the game was enjoyable, but due to my dissatisfaction, I cannot give this game my recommendation.

reviewText: I'm seeing a lot of reviewers who played the game for 1 hour and said it was too easy. As with most RPGs or MMOs for that matter there is  a sliding scale of difficulty that begins to ramp up the higher you get. I think this is to give you an easy arena in which to learn the class you've chosen - but I had to start being careful in dungeons in the lvl 18-20 realm.\n\nI could see this game being repetive but I'm quite surprised to be honest at how fun it was. I've spend 1k hours playing PoE and more than that in D3, and this felt pretty familiar. Combat feels crisp, it appears that there is some depth to the crafting system (too early to tell), and a card system (talismans") that kind of works like the cards in Warframe. Art is great
date: and personally I love playing as a tiny girl with a bigass gun. A lot of the mobs do look like they were lifted straight from WoW and D3
recommended: and in fact it almost feels like that is what Tirion was going for...the perfect mashup of those two games.\n\nDespite the somewhat derivative feel
hoursPlayed: it still feels unique enough to where I anticipate logging a few hundred hours
voteText: and definitely getting into the end game to see what that is about. I'll update this review after significantly more time playing it
helpfulPercent: but for now I give it a solid 7/10. It's free
votesHelpful: and from what I can tell so far there aren't any mega-game-breaking benefits only available through real money transactions. No reason not to try it
votesTotal: especially for the ARPG/MMO fan and those who like Blizz games."

reviewText:
I'll will start this review with saying I'm not a professional reviewer.

This game can be best describe as Diablo + Tera gameplay to bring an awesome game.
It's simple gameplay that fans of Diablo, Torchlight and Path of Exile will have fun with.

The complexity of the skill-tree is simple enough that casual and hardcore players will enjoy.

The only thing I've seen to dislike is the mounts and pets within the cash store which gives bonus & stats.
THIS IS COMPLETELY OPTIONAL FOR PVE AND NOT REQUIRED TO ENJOY THE GAME.
Within the first 15 levels you will get your first mount for free

The value of the content you're getting for free within the PVE/PVE I will totally recommend playing this least once or twice to see if you enjoy it.
This is perhaps the best F2P game I've played on steam so far.

I will continue to update this review as I see fit.

reviewText: I feel the need to clarify the p2w" accusations being spread about Devilian.\n\nIt's not a "pay to win" game in the least. All shop items are either cosmetic
date: refinment items (which can be obtained and traded) or boosts. This is typical in a f2p as they must have some flow of income. All of them can be greatly ignored and handled in game.\n\nYou also receive [DEX] item which can be transfered and used in the money shop. Yes
hoursPlayed: but again -- just because it's f2p doesn't mean they shouldn't be compensated for their game.\n\nIs this game perfect? Far from it
voteText:
but is easily the best ARPG MMO hybrid I have played to date. Aesthetic and art direction will not please all but compared to the competition this game pops.

Highly recommend and props to Trion for bringing over a solid MMO. I look forward to many hours enjoying this title.

"

reviewText:
First, it should be noted the computer I usually play this on doesn't like to open the Glyph launcher through Steam so my time on the game is MUCH more than what it shows on Steam :)

Okay, now with that aside, on with the review of thus far 12+ hours of gameplay. I decided to try this game because of all the negative reviews I saw on here. The main gripes were the same as when Archeage launched: I have to wait in a que, I need to prove I’m not a bot, you can get better crap if you pay...blah, blah, blah. Whatever, right? So I played Archeage hardcore … like REALLY hard core--dropped 100$+ in just for a pegasus … yeah you read that right :/ So no plans on dropping money in this game, even for a dope-a** ride, no plans to buy nerd glasses, or wings, or whatnot, so not spending money is no big deal, and I have YET to see a need. Also, I haven’t once had to wait in a que, or prove I’m not a bot … but I did drop all that money into Archeage so I have a validated account already.

So, on to the game. I first tried out the cannonier, it was cool, but not my style. Then I made a gay looking guy and tried the shadowhunter, he was awesome but I missed my Ellamina, so I made an Evoker. Though I didn’t like the cannonier much all three classes were fun to play, and I never wanted to try berserker so, meh. It is fast paced, kill, kill, kill and easy to play.

So the breakdown:

What is it like?
Imagine PWI, WoW, and Diablo had a baby with a dash of Rusty Hearts, that is my overall take on the game. You have the Diablo like play style with a look of WoW and PWI and all the stuff Rusty Hearts was missing, hence why RH has gone the way of the Dinosaurs--sad face (fingers crossed for RHR).

Pros:
Easy to play
Pretty to look at
Nice options for character building

Cons:
Gender locked classes--con if you don’t like that, I don’t care
Patron perks--haven’t found it to be necessary like it is in Archeage but people may not like that folks will get more for the monthly fee
Other pay advantages--like I said, I haven’t seen this negatively effect my FTP so not an issue for me but could be a con for others

So, that’s it, for me this is a 9/10, only 9 because I could see a WANT to spend money in the future as the game grows
;-P

reviewText:
Brilliant, not going to go into too much detail like the other reviews and ruin the game for y'all.

Please read the following to understand what I think:

1. Download the game

2. Download the Patch for the game.

3. Create an Account

4. Log-in

5. Make a character that you want to play throughout the game. If you're not sure, or want to play the best class in the game you can research, but I recommend making all characters and making your prefered class your main. (The one you plan on putting the most effort into)

6. Play through the story, get used to playing your classes and once you decide on your class later on, you should consider looking up some rotations, builds whatever you want to call them.

7. Enjoy the game, take the time to experience it and not rush to end content. Finally, don't go and ruin a game by hacking if you don't like it, just uninstall and forget it exists.


I think i've covered everything I wanted to say, I hope to see you in-game, my characters name is Cyndrical" if you have any questions and i'll assist you the best I can."

reviewText:
Too early of a release to give a full fledged review, and I do NOT own any level capped players as of now. I can say this.....

The flow of this game just feels amazing to me. Almost diablo-esqueue, mixed with some MMO goodness, and it's own sort of flair. The battle is pretty fluent which is a neccessity to an action rpg (and the lack of this has caused many past action MMOs to bite the dust quick imo). The general don't stand in fire" rule applies for most boss/super encounters and each class comes with a dodge skill for close calls.

As for the story-line
recommended: do I care. If you play MMOs for a storyline driven by artificial intelligence you will have to read another review for insight. I play an MMO for group-driven advancement
hoursPlayed:
and player-vs-player competition. I will be basing my review on this (maybe after the game progresses I will review it again with an opinion on this matter).

Instance queueing is another feauture I enjoyed in Devilian. No waiting 2 hours on a tank and healer in an endless queue.... Queue for an instance and usually you will have a group together rather quickly (atleast as of now....). I also love the fact you can queue for a 20-vs-20 pvp battleground  right after you dive into the game and learn the basic controls.

Love the dark devil characters with two states (you can be your normal state or go Devilian (devil) mode). The devilian state characters had advanced/modified skills
voteText: and some other powerhouse skills unique to devilian mode. You can trigger this mode after charging it
helpfulPercent: or some battlegrounds and events force you to use your Devilian state for the entire instance/event.\n\nOverall its one of the very few free to play games I didn't delete after level 20 of character progression
votesHelpful: and will re-review once I have put hours into end-game content.... but download me
votesTotal: try me
votesFunny: love me..... you shouldnt be disappointed if you are into MMORPGs or Action RPGs such as Diablo."

reviewText:
Things I like:
- You may pick one of 2 presets of controls, like moving with your mouse vs moving with the keyboard.
- Nice log system - like in WoW you may have several separate logs for different messages and events.

Things I don't like:
- Limited customizing of characters. No choosing sex or outfit.
- Cinematics can't be skipped
- Can't turn off global messages from other players.
- No chests, barrels, shrines, doors or anything else to interact with in the environments.
- The game feels more like playing an app than a computer game, but I can't really put my finger on why.

reviewText:
Devilian is a standard MMO with elements of dungeon crawler and action RPG. Even though it is simple, it is also quite fun. It's easy to get into and learn, and it has a lot to offer.

Personally, I can't stop playing. I was looking for an MMO to play, similar to Tera or FlyFF, just to scratch an itch. I typically don't go for the free to play games, but the paywall is easy to get around if you play enough. Now I'm logging in everyday for dailies and dungeon crawling, I even started a guild.

Long story short, it's simple, fun, and really scratches that MMO itch. There's nothing to lose, it's free! So try it out. Download it, play it, enjoy it.

reviewText:
This game is trying to beat the hype of Lost Ark, by rushing to release a similar art-fighting style. These characters you choose are just rejects / recycles of Tera, which was better in my opinion.

You are allowed minimal customization on a scale that won't matter due to you and everybody else being at an aeriel view 99% of the time. Your eye color or face tattoo that is covered by hair will never be noticed.

You can put Justin bieber hair on somebody who has the body structre of The Rock(avoiding John Cena meme.)
There really isn't anything original to this game, there is way too much boob shaking, in an attempt to appeal to the teen boys who can't hide their porn from their parents.

The client which switching to Windowed Borderless isn't stable.

The pros of this game are just simply aesthetic in it's a filler until a better comes along.

You are gender locked into roles. The Chat and Announcement box are default in the way, and are a bother when you have to run west or south west.

Waste of time essentially. Go play some more D3 or Tera until Lost Ark comes out.

reviewText:
Things I like:
- You may pick one of 2 presets of controls, like moving with your mouse vs moving with the keyboard.
- Nice log system - like in WoW you may have several separate logs for different messages and events.

Things I don't like:
- Limited customizing of characters. No choosing sex or outfit.
- Cinematics can't be skipped
- Can't turn off global messages from other players.
- No chests, barrels, shrines, doors or anything else to interact with in the environments.
- The game feels more like playing an app than a computer game, but I can't really put my finger on why.

reviewText:
Devilian is a traditional asian F2P aRPG MMO, so if you liked Aion, Tera or any other MMO in that vein there's no reason that you wouldn't have a good time in Devilian.

The game has nice graphics coupled with a rather bland story and aRPG combat. Here's my first 20 minutes with the game: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dnAvat5SRCU

The install is 7.1 GB and there's a thirdparty installer called Glyph that you need to run besides Steam.

reviewText:
This game has tight controls, looks nice, and sounds nice. the combat is fuild and skill based, not just point and click, you can also move with WASD or MOBA styled with the mouse. This game is very polished, it just dosn't need you that much.
From this perspective the game should be 10/10. And it can be 10/10 to the intended audience, read the bottom paragraph to see why I think the game is unplayable and why it might be for you too.

[PROS]
+ Wow it feels good to play
+ Access to explore right after tutorial
+ Community/Chat is welcoming, funny, helpful
+ Looks and sounds beautifully, blend of 'Still' painting cinematics and ingame cutscenes.

[CONS]
- Gender locked classes
- Typical oversexualization of female characters. yeah I know its in every* MMO but its not an excuse
- 'Go here and do that thing 4 times' type of questing we are sick and tired of.


IT'S TOO DAMN EASY. I choose the gunner class and after the tutorial I went to explore (seems you dont need to quest to progress to new areas, thought there's a limit to that.) Anyways, at first it made sense that it was all easy since y'know the game just started. But then being the masochistic I must play on the hardest difficulty" player I unequiped all my gear except for the tutorial weapon. WOW was I dissapointed when i beat a boss 4 levels above me. So then I realize the game only needs you to press one button
date: your basic attack. This is a boss battle we are talking about
recommended: whats the point of the beautiful controls and polished skills when you can stand still and basic attack a boss to death with no worries. The game just dosn't need you to try and PERSONALLY that makes the game unplayable to ME."

reviewText:
If you love template MMO's with cash shops and boring combat, then this is the game for you.

Devilian if you don't know is a western release of the ever so popular, Korean Devilian. So popular infact, the developer Ginno Games decided to shut it down whilst Devilian west was still in beta. That's a good start to a 'new' game. If you love taking the micky out of poor translations, then you will love reading the subtitles for this game if anything.

I have no idea why Trion decided to buy this title, why Trion? I played Devilian when it was in beta, and when they announced the 'founders pack' (yeah that new way of grabbing as much money off over hyped people who haven't played the game yet and want to pay to get into beta, and people who like shiny things to make them feel special compared to everyone else) you just knew this game was going to be a piece of doo-doo.

* Character Creation *

What character creation? you have a choice of five different faces and some tattoos, that's it. You can't even change the height or weight of your character, I mean what the hell, what year is this. If this hasn't put you off playing this game, just wait and see.

* Combat *

Nothing special here. Get spells, put them on your bar, smash them until your bar goes down and then back up, then smash them again. This hasn't been done before.

* Cash Shop*

When you implement a feature where people can buy 'speaker phones' where they can talk to everyone online playing and have no way of hiding it, you're what's wrong with game development. Seriously, if someone speaks in chat with one of these things, you cannot hide it, you will see every stupid word they say (great feature for gold sellers)

* Story *

I watched the cutscenes (the ones you can't skip) and I don't remember a thing.


So yeah, give this game a miss because it will most likely die in a few months or until Trion decides to stop putting money into it and fire a bunch of people. Avoid this piece of rubbish at all costs, go play Rift or something.

reviewText:
Downloaded ~7gb on steam, glyph wants me to download another 7gb.
Tried the guided workaround, didn't work.
Will keep trying to download, but boy will this have to be fun after all this hustle to start playing for a reccomendation.

Few hours into the game, the classes are decent though not exceptional in any way; same goes for their skills; genderlocking didn't bother me all that much. The Devil form is a nice touch, but that's about it. The controls are nice enough, though they do feel a bit clunky.

The graphics are nothing exceptional but I quite liked them, expecially as I found the world design to be rather well done.

Due to the shared world most quest mobs respawn at ridiculous rates, which makes the leveling process seem even more pointless than the total lack of challenge whatsoever already does.

Story is lackluster as well as the voice acting so far.

Don't really see me putting much more time into this game, since there are quite a few and in my opinion better ARPG alternatives out there. I didn't experience much of the MMO part of this game, which might be its saving grace; the start has, however, been so boring in addition to the troubles actually getting the game to start, that I simply can't be ♥♥♥♥♥ to waste any more time on it.

I'd rate the game slightly below average and since there are so many more, sometimes even free alternatives, I don't reccomend it. If you have a lot of time on your hands or are bored with the above mentioned alternatives, this game won't hurt to try out; simply don't expect much and be prepared for TRION-hijinks, that will eventually be this game's downfall.

reviewText:
I read some reviews before and expected a good PoE/D3 free-to-play clone with an open world.
But in my opinion this is a bad effort and aims for your purse quite bluntly.
Sadly a big waste of time/bandwith due to an unnecessary big download, but read below:

Pro:

free download

Cons:

-unnecessarily big download (7 gb from steam + 7 gb glyph update + again 1.7 gb steam update)
-although it is now a steam game: extra account for glyph needed
-combats are no challenge, too easy
-bad User Interface (small, blurred fonts, no settings to adjust opacity, fontsize, chat windows etc.)
-fake open world, very linear
-environment, obstacles cant be destroyed (only if it's a barricade to next instance)
-spells, effects look somehow cheap
-lags, suddenly warping/teleporting on europe server or clipping bugs
-reaction to keypress is very clunky
-no random and very limited loot
-game is obviously set to make you pay as soon as possible even for standard things

In total a big disappointment when you are used to Path of exile or Diablo 2/3
Maybe WoW players might like it because of its kill x of y"
recommended: get c missions and the quick feeling of success - but it never really feels like a challenge."

reviewText:
These people must have never played a game in their lives.  Non-standard shortcuts, no option for UI scaling, failure to handle alt+tab even in windowed fullscreen mode, no ability interrupts in the input stack and beyond juvenile character physics.

They sure have you with the F2P gouge model though.  They hook you good with quick low-level progression.  I bet the last half of the progression is a brutal grindfest.

And the best part, they have a system in place to make maximum profit off the gold spammers.  You can't get rid of all public chat channels.  There is a pay-to-chat system in place that bypasses all options.

0/10 do not recommend.

reviewText:
More shovelware MMOs from Trion.

This one instead of being a wow clone, or a minecraft clone, is a Diablo clone. But, seeing how this is trion they of course had to ♥♥♥♥ it up. How do you ♥♥♥♥ up a diablo clone you may ask? Let's find out!

First off the controls are honestly the worst out of any ARPG I have ever played. Click to move is clearly not the intended way to move, they want you to use WASD... How is click to move clearly not meant to be used you may ask? Simple, holding left click does not result in a smooth running animation it instead causes dozens of little clicks each making your character B line for the new marker. You end up looking like you have parkinsons everytime you need to change direction and it just feels off and wrong. Your character also randomly decides to refuse to listen to the Attack in place key (aka shift) and will constantly charge into what you are trying to attack from a range. Cause after all you're not supposed to play this blatent diablo clone like a diablo game, you need to move with WASD and attack with 1-5 cause we're trion and we have no ♥♥♥♥ing idea how a top down ARPG is supposed to play. While on the subject of Attack in Place, it flat out doesnt work for attacks other than left click. If you try to hold shift while using any other attack your character will flat out refuse and do nothing.

How you ♥♥♥♥ up controls on a genre that was perfected almost 20 years ago goes to show the dedication Trion has to producing garbage free to play games. Not only that, but how do you ♥♥♥♥ up the controls this badly? My only guess is they simply took a 3rd person engine or game, moved the camera, disabled camera controls, and called it an ARPG. I can see no other reason for WASD movements, an attack in place button that feels like its code is failing to execute 50% of the time, and number keys being the default attack buttons with the mouse buttons not working.

Next up is fun factor. A large portion of the fun from ARPG diablo style games is the shower of loot you get and the excitment of seeing rare drops (before you inevitably find out its useless). Once again trion falls flat on their ♥♥♥♥ing faces. This is a diablo style ARPG with close to no loot. Loot drops at specific points or seems to be so incredibly rare that the only loot I got while playing was from quests. Once again. how you take a very simple game formula and ♥♥♥♥ it up so spectacularly is truly a sight to behold.

One last point I'd like to touch is trion's need to include fan service classes for pedophiles. I honestly couldnt be more ♥♥♥♥ing tired of these classes designed to look like 8 year old girls in MMOs. I feel like there is one artist working on all these f2p mmos that needs to be in a cell right now. I get how its a big thing in asia but we are not in vietnam or S Korea, and only otaku types find these models anything but horrifying. Not only are these designs creepy they totally lock an entire class behind a pedophile wall.

But hey, this is Trion. Chances are this is an asian MMO that failed horribly sometime in the past 2-5 years. At which point trion swooped it up, stuck more ♥♥♥♥♥♥ signature mechanics in it and, and released it to the EU NA markets.

Do Steam even checks any of the content they add? Seems to me they just open the gates to be flooded with BS like this in recent year:D Played the game, graphics really look dated even on highest settings, if you zoom in, background textures looks like mashed potatoes:DD Gameplay is just generic, combat is decent, but aint nowhere near as polished or fluid as you might hoped:) I kinda have a feeling this game was designed  not around of being a great game, but aruond being decent enough for people to stick aruond to suck some money out of you.
